intro: Wendlandia scabra, commonly known as the roughleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, rough-textured leaves and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Wendlandia scabra is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ease of care.
